title: Decompose Glyph - OpenType
content:
Is there an advantage to decomposing accented glyphs   
derived from components? Years ago I remember a reason   
for doing this with Fontographer as there was a snag with   
certain Windows systems.   
   
Recently I've noticed my OpenType fonts not showing their   
accented characters on the Myfonts.com server. I decomposed   
the accented glyphs and everything now appears.   
Is this an OT thing? Fontlab?

 [‹ Romanian T comma Vs. T cedilla](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007051811/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3970 "Go to previous forum topic") [Fontagrapher problems ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081007051811/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3801 "Go to next forum topic")
author: eolson

comments.content: You should not decompose for TrueType fonts, but you should decompose for PostScript fonts. Maintain FontLab sources with undecomposed composites, and only decompose when you generate fonts. Be careful not to save a decomposed source over your composed one.
